longDef.en: an official agreement that finishes an argument

examples.en: It now seems unlikely that it will be possible to negotiate/reach a peaceful settlement of the conflict.
examples.cn: 现在看来和平解决这一冲突是不可能的。

examples.en: As part of their divorce settlement, Jeff agreed to let Polly keep the house.
examples.cn: 作为离婚协议的一部分，杰夫同意房子归波莉所有。

longDef.en: an arrangement to end a disagreement involving a law having been broken, without taking it to a law court, or an amount of money paid as part of such an arrangement

examples.en: The actor accepted a settlement of $100,000 from the magazine.
examples.cn: 这名演员接受了杂志10万美元的庭外和解费。

longDef.en: a place where people come to live or the process of settling in such a place

examples.en: A large Roman settlement has been discovered just outside the French town.
examples.cn: 在这座法国城市郊外发现了一处大型古罗马人定居点。

examples.en: Many Native Americans were killed during the settlement of the American West by Europeans in the 19th century.
examples.cn: 许多美洲印第安人在19世纪欧洲人在美国西部开拓殖民地的过程中被杀害。

longDef.en: the action of paying money to someone

examples.en: The settlement of his debts took him several months.
examples.cn: 他花了几个月时间才还清了债务。

examples.en: I enclose a cheque in settlement of your claim.
examples.cn: 我附上一张支票支付你的索赔。

examples.en: Her mother made a settlement on her (= made a formal arrangement to give her money) when she started college.
examples.cn: 她开始读大学时，她母亲赠与了她一笔钱。

longDef.en: the process of the slow sinking of a building or the ground
